alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:53PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected near Moses Coulee on the Waterville Plateau. * WHERE...A portion of central Douglas county. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Radar estimates shows between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. - The storms are tracking south toward Highway 2. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mansfield, Sims Corner and Mold. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
